# mouseDragged(with:)

**Instance Method**

Informs the view that the user has moved the mouse with the left button pressed.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor @preconcurrency override dynamic func mouseDragged(with event: NSEvent)
```

## Parameters

- **event**: An object encapsulating information about the mouse event.

## Discussion

The view handles the event instead of passing it to the next responder. See [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppKit/NSResponder] for more information about the responder chain.

## Handling mouse input

- **mouseDown(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has pressed the left mouse button.
- **mouseUp(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has released the left mouse button.
- **mouseMoved(with:)**: Informs the view that the mouse has moved.
- **rightMouseDown(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has pressed the right mouse button.
- **rightMouseDragged(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has moved the mouse with the right button pressed.
- **rightMouseUp(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has released the right mouse button.
- **otherMouseDown(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has pressed a mouse button other than the left or right one.
- **otherMouseDragged(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has moved the mouse with a button other than the left or right button pressed.
- **otherMouseUp(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has released a mouse button other than the left or right button.
- **scrollWheel(with:)**: Informs the view that the mouse’s scroll wheel has moved.
